elements.title: The Banquet of Cleopatra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that The Banquet of Cleopatra (pictured) depicts Cleopatra drinking a dissolved pearl to impress Mark Antony?

elements.title: Antonie Mielke (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an on-stage incident traumatized Antonie Mielke so much that she retired from opera?

elements.title: Volimidia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that people entered the Bronze Age tombs at Volimidia centuries later in the Iron Age to leave offerings to the dead?

elements.title: Zhang Xichen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Zhang Xichen founded a magazine to compete with one made by his own employer?

elements.title: Harvard's first modern feeder school (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Harvard's first modern feeder school cost twice as much as Harvard itself?

elements.title: Heaven and Earth, and Sea and Air (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the text of "Heaven and Earth, and Sea and Air" was written by the man after whom the Neandertal was named?

elements.title: Richard A. Hunter (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the unique, if "Freudian", partnership between Richard A. Hunter and his mother was the most prolific in publishing in the history of psychiatry?

elements.title: Amblyseius anacardii (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, contrary to the perception of Phytoseiidae, Amblyseius anacardii is observed as an agricultural pest?

elements.title: Ngataba Min (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, according to legend, Ngataba Min became king after eating the head of a rooster?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

Kowloon

One of the most densely populated cities on Earth, Hong Kong's mainland portion offers a culture less influenced by the British than the neighboring Island, plus accommodation, dining, and nightlife are generally cheaper.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Andorra la Vella

Andorra la Vella is the capital of a quirky co-principality lodged in the mountains between Spain and France that offers great skiing, hiking, and lots of duty-free shopping.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

San Diego International Airport

The main airport to America's finest city is the busiest single runway airport in the world.
